category.name: Middle Eastern, Near Eastern and North African Studies
Southeast Asian and Pacific Languages and Cultures
Middle Eastern, Near Eastern and North African Studies
Southeast Asian and Pacific Languages and Cultures

database.name: Ethnic NewsWatch
database.database_description: A full text database of 200 publications of the ethnic, minority and native press. Searchable in both English and Spanish, with titles in both languages. Includes more than 100,000 articles in Spanish and over 400,000 in English.

database.name: International Political Science Abstracts [SilverPlatter WebSpirs 5.0]
database.database_description: Provides abstracts of political science articles published in scholarly journals and yearbooks worldwide. Topics include method and theory, political thinkers, ideas, administrative institutions, national and area studies.

database.name: JSTOR (Journal Storage Project)
database.database_description: Provides full-text access to the archives of core scholarly journals in the humanities and social sciences.

database.name: MLA International Bibliography (CSA)
database.database_description: The MLA International Bibliography is a subject index for books and articles published on modern languages, literatures, folklore, and linguistics.

database.name: Oxford University Press Online Journals
database.database_description: Provides full-text access to recent volumes of scholarly journals in all subject areas published by Oxford University Press.

database.name: Project MUSE
database.database_description: Full-text access to over 100 scholarly journals in the arts and humanities, social sciences and mathematics published by Johns Hopkins University Press and other university presses (Duke, Hawaii, Indiana, MIT, Penn State, etc.).

database.name: ProQuest (all databases combined)
database.database_description: Combined access to ProQuest databases including: ABI/INFORM Dateline, ABI/INFORM Global, ABI/INFORM Trade & Industry, Alt-Press Watch, Ethnic NewsWatch, GenderWatch, OxResearch, ProQuest Dissertations and Theses, ProQuest Research Library, and the Snapshots International Series.

database.name: ProQuest Research Library (ProQuest)
database.database_description: Indexes over 3,800 journals and magazines covering all fields and topics, academic and popular, beginning as early as 1971.

database.name: PsycINFO (EBSCO)
database.database_description: This database contains more than one million citations and summaries of journal articles, book chapters, books, dissertations and technical reports, all in the field of psychology. It also includes information about the psychological aspects of related disciplines such as medicine, psychiatry, nursing, sociology, education, pharmacology, physiology, linguistics, anthropology, business and law. Journal coverage, which spans from 1887 to present, includes international material selected from more than 2,100 periodicals in over 35 languages.

database.name: ScienceDirect (Elsevier)
database.database_description: Contains the full text of more than 1,000 Elsevier Science journals in the life, physical, medical, technical, and social sciences. Also includes citations and abstracts only for core scientific journals not published by Elsevier.

database.name: Social Sciences Abstracts (OCLC)
database.database_description: Social Sciences Abstracts provides accurate, up-to-date coverage of the social sciences. Its records describe feature articles, biographical sketches, interviews, obituaries, scholarly replies, and book reviews longer than one-half page; book reviews of government documents and letters to the editor are not included. Each record contains a bibliographic citation and library holdings for the journal.

database.name: Sociological Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: CSA Sociological Abstracts abstracts and indexes the international literature in sociology and related disciplines in the social and behavioral sciences. The database provides abstracts of journal articles and citations to book reviews drawn from over 1,700 serials publications, and also provides abstracts of books, book chapters, dissertations, and conference papers. Records added after 1974 contain in-depth and nonevaluative abstracts of journal articles.

database.name: Wilson Select Plus (OCLC)
database.database_description: Indexing and abstracts plus full text for articles from 1,350+ general, humanities, business, science & social science periodicals. Portions of 14 different Wilson indexes combined into a single database, with full text included for every article covered.

database.name: ABC-CLIO
database.database_description: Access to the ABC-CLIO databases America: History and Life, and Historical Abstracts.

database.name: Alternative Press Index [OCLC FirstSearch]
database.database_description: The leading guide to the alternative press in North America. Indexes nearly 300 alternative, radical, and left publications, which report and analyze the practices and theories of cultural, economic, political, and social change. 90% are not indexed elsewhere.

database.name: ERIC (OCLC)
database.database_description: Indexes journal articles, government publications and unpublished materials such as conference papers, reports, theses and more. (Unpublished materials are available on microfiche in the Graduate Library.)

database.name: ProQuest Newsstand: Financial Times
database.database_description: Full text of the Financial Times published in London, England (1996- ) and of articles from its associated online news service, FT.com (2001- ).

database.name: GenderWatch
database.database_description: A full text database of 140 international publications devoted to women's and gender issues, including scholarly journals, magazines, and newspapers, plus reports, pamphlets, papers and conference proceedings.

database.name: Readers' Guide Abstracts (OCLC)
database.database_description: Indexes and briefly summarizes articles from 240 popular periodicals published in the U.S. & Canada, covering current events & news, fine arts, fashion, education, business, sports, health and nutrition, consumer affairs, etc

database.name: America: History and Life
database.database_description: Citations and abstracts to social science and humanities literature on all aspects of U.S. and Canadian history, culture, and current affairs from prehistoric times to the present.

database.name: American Periodicals Series (APS)
database.database_description: Search a selection of periodicals that first began publishing between 1740 and 1900, including special interest and general magazines, literary and professional journals, children's and women's magazines, and many other historically-significant periodicals.

database.name: Arts and Humanities Citation Index (ISI Web of Science)
database.database_description: Available through ISI Web of Science, allows searching for articles that cite a known author or work, as well as searching by subject, author, journal, and author address. Indexes 1,100 of the world's leading arts and humanities journals.

database.name: Mirlyn
database.database_description: Library Catalog of the University of Michigan. Includes catalogs for the University Library, Bentley Historical Library and Clements Library at UM-Ann Arbor, and for the Thompson Library at UM-Flint. Contains information about items available at these four libraries

database.name: Anthropology Plus (RLG)
database.database_description: A comprehensive, international index to the literature of anthropology and archaeology, Anthropology Plus combines two major indexes: Harvard University's Anthropological Literature database and the United Kingdom's Anthropological Index. The database covers all journal articles, reports, commentaries, obituaries, etc. at least two pages long in over 2,500 journals and monographic series. Covers the fields of social, cultural, physical, biological, and linguistic anthropology, ethnology, archaeology, folklore, and material culture. Limited to 5 concurrent users.

database.name: Avery Index to Architectural Periodicals (CSA)
database.database_description: Citations to articles from architecture and related periodicals, emphasizing the fields of architectural design and history.

database.name: Bibliography of Asian Studies
database.database_description: Contains over 410,000 citations to western-language periodical articles and books published on all subjects pertaining to East, Southeast, and South Asia.

database.name: Biosis Previews [ISI Web of Knowledge]
database.database_description: Comprehensive index to life sciences research literature. Covers journals (5000+), reports, meetings (1500+), reviews, and books in all areas of biology. Weekly email alerts available.

database.name: Book Review Digest (OCLC)
database.database_description: Index to reviews of fiction and non-fiction books appearing in 100 periodicals published in the U.S., Canada and Great Britain. Adds reviews of over 7,000 adult and children's books each year.

database.name: Essay and General Literature Index (OCLC)
database.database_description: Indexes articles in books (collections of essays) focusing on the humanities and social sciences, published in the U.S., Canada and Great Britain. Covers 300 books and 20 annual series each year.

database.name: FRANCIS (RLG)
database.database_description: Provides indexing and abstracts of books and articles from over 4,200 European-language journals in the humanities and social sciences--especially in religion, history of art, literature, philosophy, and economics.

database.name: Humanities Abstracts (OCLC)
database.database_description: The Humanities Abstracts database contains abstracts for more than 300 humanities publications. It abstracts feature articles, book reviews, interviews, obituaries, bibliographies, original works of fiction (including dramas and poems), and reviews of plays and television and radio programs. ##It excludes editorials, letters to the editor, news, ephemeral announcements, cartoons, and advertising. Each record contains a bibliographic citation for an article, book review, or other item in a journal and library holdings for the journal title.

database.name: Index Islamicus (CSA)
database.database_description: Indexes materials on Islam, the Middle East, and the entire Muslim world from periodicals, monographs, and other collections in European languages. Includes coverage arts & humanities, history and social sciences topics.

database.name: Linguistics and Language Behavior Abstracts (LLBA) (CSA)
database.database_description: Covers linguistics and related disciplines such as language acquisition, bilingualism, and artificial intelligence.

database.name: OAIster
database.database_description: Uses the Open Archives Initiative (OAI) protocol to gather over 11 million records of free, useful, wide-ranging digital resources hosted at over 750 institutions.

database.name: PapersFirst (OCLC)
database.database_description: Contains citations of over 2 million papers presented at worldwide meetings, conferences, expositions, workshops, congresses, and symposia that have been received by the British Library. (Derived from tables of contents in ProceedingsFirst.)

database.name: Social Sciences Citation Index (ISI Web of Science)
database.database_description: A multidisciplinary database, with searchable author abstracts, covering the journal literature of the social sciences. It indexes 1,700 journals spanning 50 disciplines.

database.name: WorldCat (OCLC)
database.database_description: Over 40 million records describing books, periodicals, sound recordings, videos, musical scores, archival materials and much more. Shows what materials are held by most libraries in North America and some in Europe.

database.name: Art Full Text (Wilson)
database.database_description: Indexes key international English-language arts publications, including periodicals, yearbooks, museum bulletins, competition & award notices, exhibition listings, interviews, film reviews, and more. Includes full text for selected articles since 1997.

database.name: ARTbibliographies Modern (CSA)
database.database_description: Abstracts of articles, books, essays, exhibition catalogs & reviews, and dissertations covering artists & movements from the late 19th century to all aspects of modern & contemporary art, including photography from its invention in 1839 to the present.

database.name: ARTstor
database.database_description: ARTstor is a non-profit initiative, founded by The Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, with a mission to use digital technology to enhance scholarship, teaching and learning in the arts and associated fields.

database.name: Design & Applied Arts Index (DAAI) (CSA)
database.database_description: Contains over 100,000 annotated references to articles from over 450 design and craft journals published worldwide; plus data on over 46,000 designers, craftspeople, studios, workshops, firms, etc.

database.name: Art Index Retrospective (Wilson)
database.database_description: Indexes key international English-language arts publications, including periodicals, yearbooks, museum bulletins, competition & award notices, exhibition listings, film reviews, etc. Covers earlier period not covered by other versions of Art Index. ##A unique resource, Art Index Retrospective helps users find contemporary criticism of art at the time of its debut, track the body of work of an artist or movement, find artists’ interviews and other commentary, and much more.

database.name: Bibliography of the History of Art (CSA)
database.database_description: Covering European and American art from late antiquity to the present, the Bibliography of the History of Art indexes and abstracts art-related books, conference proceedings and dissertations, exhibition and dealer's catalogs.

database.name: General Reference Center Gold [InfoTrac Web]
database.database_description: Provides indexing for 1,100 general interest magazines, newspapers, business and industry journals, and reference books, with full text for articles from 700 of them.

database.name: SCIPIO: Art and Rare Book Sales Catalog
database.database_description: Describes art auction and rare book catalogs for sales from the late sixteenth century to scheduled auctions not yet held, from all major North American and European auction houses as well as important private sales. Records include the dates and places of sales, the auction houses, sellers, institutional holdings, and titles of works.

database.name: Oxford Reference Online
database.database_description: Fully indexed, cross-searchable database of about 100 dictionary, language reference, and subject reference works published by Oxford University Press. Includes subject reference works in the humanities, social sciences, and science.

database.name: Historical Abstracts
database.database_description: Indexing with abstracts for 2,000+ journals and other materials relating to world history (excluding the U.S. and Canada) from 1450 to the present. Covers political, diplomatic, economic, social, cultural, and intellectual history.

database.name: Alternative Press Index Archive [OCLC FirstSearch]
database.database_description: Comprehensive guide to alternative sources of information published from 1969-1990. Indexes alternative, radical and left periodicals, newspapers and magazines. Provides alternative viewpoints on subjects of national and international interest.

database.name: Corpus of Middle English Prose and Verse
database.database_description: A collection of Middle English texts including Chaucer's Canterbury Tales & Troilus and Criseyde, Langland's Piers Plowman, Malory's Morte Darthur, Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Everyman, and many others.

database.name: Current Contents Connect (ISI)
database.database_description: Indexes the table-of-contents pages of scholarly journals, books and conference proceedings in the fields of medicine, science, engineering, the arts, social sciences, and humanities.##Users can save searches as e-mail alerts.

database.name: Early English Books Online (EEBO)
database.database_description: When complete EEBO will contain page images of 125,000 volumes in all subject areas published in Great Britain or in the English language between 1475 and 1700, and represented in the English Short Title Catalog and Thomason Tracts.

database.name: Electronic Collections Online (OCLC)
database.database_description: Indexing and browsable tables of contents for over 2,800 journals in all subject areas, with full text for the 351 of them subscribed to by the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. (An OCLC FirstSearch database.)

database.name: International Index to the Performing Arts (IIPA)
database.database_description: Indexes articles in more than 200 scholarly and popular performing arts periodicals. Covers a broad spectrum of the performing arts including dance, film, television, drama and theater. Retrospectively indexes 63 periodical titles as far back as 1864.

database.name: Oxford English Dictionary (New Edition)
database.database_description: New web version of the most complete and authoritative dictionary of the English language. Contains all the second edition entries, which are gradually being supplemented with new revised entries as the third edition is created.

database.name: A-V Online (SilverPlatter)
database.database_description: A database of distribution sources for educational media on videotape, film, audiocassette, and other formats. It contains over 350,000 descriptions of videotapes, 16mm films, audio-tapes, filmstrips, slide sets, transparencies and film cartridges of an educational, documentary or informational nature. Compiled by the National Information Center for Educational Media (NICEM), with records from the Library of Congress, publishers' catalogs, & library collections.

database.name: Periodicals Index Online - formerly Periodicals Contents Index (ProQuest)
database.database_description: An index to over 14 million articles in more than 4,250 humanities and social science journals, from their first issues through 1995. Includes full text of articles for 650 of the journals covered. Covers many older journals not indexed electronically anywhere else.

database.name: Chicano Database (RLG)
database.database_description: Articles on a wide-range of subjects relating to Mexican Americans. Records added since 1992 expand the scope to include the broader Latino experience, including Puerto Ricans, Cuban Americans, and Central American immigrants. Limited to 5 concurrent users.

database.name: Literature Resource Center: Reference Works
database.database_description: Provides access to biographies, bibliographies, and critical analyses of authors from every age and literary discipline. Combines content from Gale Literary Databases: Contemporary Authors, Contemporary Literary Criticism Select, and Dictionary of Literary Biography.

database.name: Worldwide Political Science Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Provides citations, abstracts, and indexing of the international serials literature in political science and its complementary fields, including international relations, law, and public administration/policy.

database.name: ArticleFirst
database.database_description: Brief citations of articles from tables of contents of over 12,000 journals in science, technology, medicine, social science, business, the humanities, and popular culture. Updated daily.

database.name: English Short Title Catalogue (RLG)
database.database_description: Describes and provides holdings information for letterpress materials printed in any language in England or its dependencies from the beginning of printing through the end of the 18th century, as well as materials printed in English anywhere else in the world during this period. Serves as a comprehensive bibliography of the hand-press era and as a census of surviving copies. All recorded English monographs printed between 1475 and 1700 are now represented in the file.

database.name: InfoTrac OneFile
database.database_description: Provides indexing for over 8,000 scholarly and general interest journals and newspapers, with full text articles included for over 4,200 of them. Combines the content of Computer Database, Expanded Academic ASAP, General Reference Center Gold, etc.

database.name: ISI Proceedings (ISI)
database.database_description: Combined web version of Index to Scientific & Technical Proceedings (ISTP) and Index to Social Sciences & Humanities Proceedings (ISSHP). Provides citations and author abstracts of papers delivered at conferences, symposia, seminars, workshops, etc.

database.name: Russian Academy of Sciences Bibliographies (RLG)
database.database_description: Contains citations, many with abstracts, to humanities and social sciences books, manuscripts, dissertations, and articles from over 12,500 periodicals published primarily in Russia, the republics of the former Soviet Union, and countries in Eastern Europe. Topics covered include archaeology, economics, history, law, linguistics, literary criticism, philosophy, political science, religious studies, and much more.

database.name: Ecology Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Covers relevant papers on evolutionary biology, economics, and systems analysis as they relate to ecosystems or the environment.

database.name: Environmental Sciences & Pollution Management (CSA)
database.database_description: A multidisciplinary database with abstracts and citations drawn from over 5980 serials including scientific journals, conference proceedings, reports, monographs, books and government publications.

database.name: GeoRef (CSA)
database.database_description: Index to journal articles, books and some theses in the earth sciences. Topics include: all aspects of geology, solid-earth geophysics, mineralogy, paleontology, petrology, geochemistry, geochronology, energy, and stratigraphy.

database.name: Nature Online
database.database_description: Online access to the journal Nature and its sister publications in Biotechnology, Cell Biology, Genetics, Immunology, Medicine, Neuroscience, and Structural Biology.

database.name: Oceanic Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Provides bilbiographic coverage of information pertaining to the marine & brackish-water environment, focusing on marine biology & physical oceanography, fisheries, aquaculture, non-living resources, meteorology & geology, plus technological topics, etc.

database.name: Plant Science (CSA)
database.database_description: Plant Science is a bibliographic database focusing on all aspects of plant research including pathology, symbiosis, biochemistry, genetics, biotechnology, techniques, and environmental biology.

database.name: Pollution Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Pollution Abstracts provides access to environmental information concerning scientific research and government policies on atmosphere, emissions, and environmental action in response to global pollution issues.

database.name: ToxLine (CSA)
database.database_description: Covers journal articles, monographs, technical reports, theses, and other literature in all areas of toxicology, including chemicals and pharmaceuticals, pesticides, environmental pollutants, and mutagens and teratogens.

database.name: Water Resources Abstracts
database.database_description: Provides comprehensive coverage of water resources issues, including groundwater, lakes, estuaries, water supply, desalination, water yield, water quantity, groundwater management, watersheds, water quality, wastewater, and water law.

database.name: Handbook of Latin American Studies (HLAS) Online
database.database_description: A bibliography on Latin America consisting of works selected and annotated by scholars. Edited by the Hispanic Division of the Library of Congress, the multidisciplinary Handbook alternates annually between the social sciences and the humanities.

database.name: Web of Science (ISI)
database.database_description: Combines three citation indexes--Arts & Humanities, Science Expanded, and Social Sciences--which permit searching for articles that cite a known author or work, as well as searching by subject, author, journal, and author address. Covers 8,400+ journals.

database.name: PAIS International (Public Affairs Information Service) [CSA]
database.database_description: Contains references to nearly 2 million journal articles, books, government documents, statistical directories, research and conference reports, publications of international agencies, microfiche, Internet material, etc. concerning public affairs and public policy worldwide.

database.name: International Index to Music Periodicals (IIMP) Full Text
database.database_description: Indexes over 375 scholarly and popular music periodicals from more than twenty countries, including feature music articles and obituaries from the Washington Post and the New York Times, with full text for recent articles from 42 of these periodicals.

database.name: RILM Abstracts of Musical Literature [FirstSearch]
database.database_description: An international bibliography of scholarly writings on music and related disciplines, in 202 languages, classified by topic. Includes original-language titles, title translations in English, full bibliographic information, and abstracts in English. ## ##The database covers musicology, ethnomusicology, theory, analysis, composition, instruments and voice, performance practice and notation, liturgy, dance, aesthetics, criticism, music therapy and education, and iconography. Abstracts are drawn from articles, books, conference proceedings, bibliographies, catalogues, dissertations, festchriften, iconographies, critical commentaries to complete works, ethnographic recordings and videos, reviews.

database.name: Blackwell Synergy
database.database_description: Contains the full text of more than 600 Blackwell Publishing journals in the arts, humanities, and the life, physical, medical, technical, and social sciences.

database.name: Philosopher's Index (CSA)
database.database_description: Provides indexing and authors' abstracts for books and articles from over 400 journals of philosophy and related interdisciplinary fields.

database.name: ATLA Religion Database (CSA)
database.database_description: ATLA Religion & Serials Database, a comprehensive index to journal articles, book reviews, and collections of essays in all fields of religious studies, with links to online versions of a core collection of over 50 scholarly journals of religious studies.

database.name: ABSEES (American Bibliography of Slavic and East European Studies) Online
database.database_description: Covers journal articles, books, book chapters, book reviews, dissertations, and selected government publications on East-Central Europe and the former Soviet Union published in the U.S. and Canada.

database.name: ProceedingsFirst (OCLC)
database.database_description: Contains tables of contents from over 70,000 worldwide conferences, professional meetings and symposia listing papers presented, and provides an overview of the activities at such meetings. (For citations to individual papers, see PapersFirst.)

database.name: Science Citation Index (ISI Web of Science)
database.database_description: Key index to articles from major journals in all areas of science and technology. Use to find other articles citing a specific article (footnotes in reverse).

database.name: Wilson Business Abstracts (OCLC)
database.database_description: Indexing with abstracts for 300 international English-language business magazines, covering accounting, finance, management, and small business.

database.name: ABI/INFORM Dateline (ProQuest)
database.database_description: Contains news and analysis, information on local markets, and more gathered from major business tabloids, magazines, daily newspapers, wire services, and city, state, and regional business publications.

database.name: ABI/INFORM Global (ProQuest)
database.database_description: Indexing and abstracts for over 1,300 business and management-oriented publications, with full text for articles from over 600 of them. Covers over 350 titles from outside the U.S. Also covers related fields such as psychology, engineering, etc.

database.name: ABI/INFORM Trade & Industry (ProQuest)
database.database_description: Full text access to more than 750 business periodicals and newsletters with a trade or industry focus. Contains publications on every major industry, including finance, insurance, transportation, construction, and many more.

database.name: EconLit [SilverPlatter WebSPIRS 5.0]
database.database_description: Subject indexing and abstracts of journals and books, dissertations, and working papers. Topics include economic theory and history, monetary theory and financial institutions, labor economics, international, regional and urban economics.

database.name: InfoTrac Custom Newspapers
database.database_description: Searchable full text database combining articles from 80+ U.S. and British newspapers and news wires, plus a few from Mexico and East Asia. Includes the Grand Rapids Press, and selected articles from the Detroit Free Press.

database.name: ResearchNow:a bepress portal
database.database_description: ResearchNow is an extensive digital library that provides readers access to all the journals published by Berkeley Electronic Press as well as institutional repositories using bepress software, and working papers series hosted by bepress. ## ##Subjects covered in the portal include economic analysis and policy, macroeconomics, theoretical economics, business, health economics, engineering, nursing, biostatistics, law and legal studies, medicine, homeland security and emergency management, human rights, peace studies, marketing, econometrics, genetics and molecular biology. ## ##The Berkeley Electronic Press was founded by academics to address the inefficiencies that characterize the current scholarly publishing model. It is our core belief that mechanisms can be developed to streamline the publication process, creating tangible benefits for authors, editors, readers, and libraries. The Berkeley Electronic Press promotes the following goals: ## ##Scholar-led innovations in publishing ##Alternative production and dissemination of scholarship ##Reduction in costs of, and barriers to, access ##New electronic journals in underserved and emerging disciplines ##Comprehensive repositories promoting "one-stop shopping" for researchers

database.name: Risk Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Risk Abstracts provides a source for interdisciplinary perspectives on risk arising from industrial, technological, environmental and other sources and emphasizes the assessment and management of risk.

database.name: SourceOECD
database.database_description: Online library of the Organisation of Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD). Includes full-text of all books, 24 periodicals and the OECD statistical databases.

database.name: HighWire Press Journals
database.database_description: Provides full-text access to recent volumes of scholarly journals in the health, life, physical and social sciences published online by HighWire Press, the "Internet Imprint" of the Stanford University Libraries.

database.name: Business Source Complete (EBSCO)
database.database_description: This database contains the largest collection of active, peer-reviewed, business related journals available covering topics such as management, economics, finance, accounting and international business. Full text is available for management journals including Harvard Business Review, Academy of Management Journal, and the Journal of Marketing. Searchable cited references are provided for more than 1,200 journals as well as indexing and abstracts for the most important business journals dating back to 1886. Country economic reports from the EIU, WEFA, ICON Group and CountryWatch are also included. ##Use Policy: When using material from this database in reports and presentations, vendor contract requirements dictate that you must include the phrase, "Used with permission of (name of database)."

database.name: Annual Reviews
database.database_description: Provides access to authoritative, analytic reviews of research in 29 focused disciplines within the Biological & Medical, Physical, and Social Sciences. Permits searching within these three broad categories or across all 29 titles.

database.name: CANCERLIT
database.database_description: Contains references and abstracts to published cancer literature

database.name: Health & Safety Sciences Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Health & Safety Sciences Abstracts provides a survey of recent work from government reports, journal articles, books, and conference proceedings relating to aviation and aerospace, environmental, nuclear, medical, and occupational safety.

database.name: Health and Wellness Resource Center
database.database_description: Provides access to medical, health, and wellness information from authoritative medical sources including reference works, full-text magazines, journals and pamphlets, with descriptive links to selected web sites.

database.name: History of Science, Technology, and Medicine (RLG)
database.database_description: Indexes journal articles, conference proceedings, books, book reviews & dissertations in the history of science, technology, and medicine & allied historical fields. Integrates four bibliographies: the Isis Current Bibliography of the History of Science, the Current Bibliography in the History of Technology (Technology and Culture), the Bibliografia Italiana di Storia della Scienza, and the Wellcome Library for the History and Understanding of Medicine.

database.name: PubMed with UM SFX Links
database.database_description: PubMed indexes over 4,000 biomedical, nursing, dentistry and related journals, with over 15 million citations in MEDLINE, PreMEDLINE and related databases. PubMed is produced by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) and provides links between article citations and relevant data in other NCBI ENTREZ databases, including Nucleotide and Protein Sequences, Protein Structures, Complete Genomes, Taxonomy, and others.

database.name: Toxicology Abstracts
database.database_description: Worldwide index to articles, books, conference proceedings and reports relating to toxicology.

database.name: Aerospace & High Technology Database (CSA)
database.database_description: Contains citations, with abstracts, to literature on basic and applied research in aeronautics, astronautics, and space sciences. The database also includes coverage of reports issued by NASA, other U.S. government agencies, international institutions.

database.name: CSA Technology Research Database
database.database_description: Comprehensive engineering and technology database providing access to the combined records of the CSA Engineering Research Database, the CSA High Technology Research Database with Aerospace, and the CSA Materials Research Database with METADEX.

database.name: Engineering Index (Compendex) [Engineering Village 2]
database.database_description: Engineering Index (Compendex) provides international coverage of engineering and applied science literature in over 5000 journals, conference proceedings, and technical reports.

database.name: INSPEC [Engineering Village 2]
database.database_description: Covers the world-wide literature (mainly journal articles and conference proceedings papers) in astronomy, physics, electronics and electrical engineering, computers and control, and information technology.

database.name: MGA (Meteorological & Geoastrophysical Abstracts)
database.database_description: Contains citations, with abstracts for most years, to journals and series in meteorology, climatology, atmospheric chemistry and physics, physical oceanography, hydrology, glaciology, and related environmental sciences. Updated monthly.

database.name: NTIS (National Technical Information Services indexes) (CSA)
database.database_description: Indexes reports on government sponsored R&D from selected federal agencies (e.g. Department of Energy, EPA), their contractors, and their grantees (e.g. U of M).

database.name: Ocean Technology, Policy & Non-Living Resources (ASFA 2, Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Abstracts 2)
database.database_description: Covers the physical, descriptive, dynamic, chemical, geological, and biological aspects of oceanography, including limnology, ocean engineering, and specific resources.

database.name: Conference Papers Index (CSA)
database.database_description: Conference Papers provides citations to papers and poster sessions presented at major scientific meetings around the world with subject emphasis since 1995 being in the life sciences, environmental sciences and the aquatic sciences.

database.name: International Pharmaceutical Abstracts (UM-MEDSEARCH)
database.database_description: IPA provides worldwide coverage of the pharmaceutical literature. Abstracts of presentations at major pharmacy meetings are also included. ##Includes citations to clinical and technical drug information, pharmacy practice, pharmaceutical, educational, and legal aspects of pharmacy and drugs. Also indexes state pharmacy journals.

database.name: Applied Science and Technology Abstracts
database.database_description: Applied Science and Technology Abstracts (its full name) covers 350+ key, international English-language periodicals in the applied sciences and technology. It is a good source of information on management, careers and employment, and financial trends in the scientific and technological fields. It abstracts interviews, meetings, conferences, exhibitions, discussions, corrections, continued articles, new product reviews, new product announcements, technically ##valuable editorials and letters, tables, charts, diagrams, buyers' guides, directories, and ##conference proceedings; it also cites book reviews. Each record contains a bibliographic citation.

database.name: Agricultural and Environmental Biotechnology Abstracts
database.database_description: Contains citations to literature on biotechnological techniques in the food industry, agriculture, and the environment. The database also covers agricultural products involving both plants and animals and new applications across the food industry.

database.name: Aqualine (CSA)
database.database_description: Coverage of trade, technical, and scientific literature in water resources and supplies, water quality, water and waste analysis, water treatment, underground services and water use, sewage, industrial effluent, and the effects of pollution.

database.name: Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Abstracts - Aquatic Pollution & Environmental Quality (ASFA 3) (CSA)
database.database_description: Devoted exclusively to research and policy on the contamination of oceans, seas, lakes, rivers, and estuaries.

database.name: Transport Database [SilverPlatter WebSPIRS 5.0]
database.database_description: Contains citations and abstracts published in member countries of the European Conference of Ministers of Transport and associated countries about all types/modes of transport emphasizing land travel.

database.name: ACM (Association for Computing Machinery) Digital Library
database.database_description: Full-text archive of ACM publications, including journals, magazines, transactions, proceedings, and newsletters, as well as some publications by affiliated organizations.

database.name: MathSciNet (AMS)
database.database_description: MathSciNet is a searchable database providing Web access to "Mathematical Reviews", the journal of record which indexes, reviews and abstracts the published mathematical research literature.

database.name: Safari Tech Books Online
database.database_description: Searchable full text of recent technical books from O'Reilly & Associates and The Pearson Technology Group (including Addison-Wesley, Alpha, Financial Times Prentice Hall, Cisco Press, New Riders, Peachpit Press, Prentice Hall PTR, Que and Sams) and other publishers.

database.name: Biotechnology & Bioengineering Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Provides access to international research on all aspects of biochemical and microbial technology as applied to bioengineering. Information is drawn from journals, conference proceedings, directories, and other sources.

database.name: SpringerLink
database.database_description: Provides online full-text access to many of the Springer electronic journals; along with some electronic books and series.

database.name: Corrosion Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Corrosion Abstracts provides the world's most complete source of bibliographic information in the area of corrosion science and engineering.

database.name: Engineered Materials Abstracts (EMA) (CSA)
database.database_description: Covers international literature on polymers, ceramics, and composite materials for use in the design, construction and operation of structures, equipment and systems. (Combines Advanced Polymers Abstracts, Composites Industry Abstracts & EMA Ceramics.)

database.name: Materials Business File (CSA)
database.database_description: The MBF database covers technical and commercial developments in iron and steel, nonferrous metals, and relevant non-metallic materials such as polymers, ceramics, and composites.

database.name: Weldasearch (CSA)
database.database_description: The WELDASEARCH database provides comprehensive coverage in the areas of joining metals, plastics and ceramics, metal and ceramic spraying, thermal cutting, brazing, soldering and related topics.

database.name: Biography Index (OCLC)
database.database_description: A cumulative index to biographical material in English-language periodicals (over 2700) and books (over 1800 added each year).

database.name: Kresge Library INNOPAC
database.database_description: The catalog of the Kresge Business Administration Library (an independent library on the Ann Arbor campus) contains information about each item the library owns. This includes all the books in the library, as well as videos, journal subscription records, links to selected web pages, etc.

database.name: Indiana University Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the Indiana University Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on all 10 Indiana University campuses.

database.name: Michigan State University Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the Michigan State University Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on the Michigan State University campus in East Lansing.

database.name: Northwestern University Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the Northwestern University Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on both Northwestern University campuses, in Evanston and Chicago.

database.name: Ohio State University Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of The Ohio State University Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on all 4 Ohio State University campuses.

database.name: Pennsylvania State University Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the Penn State University Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on all 21 Penn State University campuses.

database.name: Purdue University Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the Purdue University Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on the Purdue University campus in West Lafayette, Indiana.

database.name: University of Chicago Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the University of Chicago Library, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on the University of Chicago campus in Chicago, Illinois and at the Yerkes Observatory in Williams Bay, Wisconsin.

database.name: University of Illinois at Chicago Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the University of Illinois at Chicago Library, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on the University of Illinois campus in Chicago.

database.name: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign Library, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on the University of Illinois campus in Urbana-Champaign, Illinois.

database.name: University of Iowa Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the University of Iowa Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on the University of Iowa campus in Iowa City.

database.name: University of Minnesota Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the University of Minnesota Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on all 4 University of Minnesota campuses.

database.name: University of Wisconsin-Madison Library Catalog
database.database_description: Catalog of the University of Wisconsin-Madison Libraries, a member of the Big Ten/CIC Universities Consortium. Contains information about items available at libraries on the University of Wisconsin campus in Madison, Wisconsin.

database.name: Catalog of U.S. Government Publications (GPO Monthly Catalog) [FirstSearch]
database.database_description: Provides citations to U.S. federal government publications. Contains references to books, reports, studies, serials, maps and other publications. Topics covered include finance, business, demographics, foreign relations, public health and social issues.

database.name: Industrial & Applied Microbiology Abstracts (Microbiology A)
database.database_description: Index to articles covering significant findings and practical applications in agricultural, food and beverage, chemical, and pharmaceutical industries.

database.name: Metadex (CSA)
database.database_description: The Metadex database provides comprehensive coverage of international literature on the science and practice of metallurgy.

database.name: CINAHL (Cumulative Index to Nursing & Allied Health Literature) [UM-MEDSEARCH]
database.database_description: The Cumulative Index to Nursing & Allied Health (CINAHL) database provides authoritative coverage of the literature related to nursing and allied health. Virtually all English-language publications are indexed along with the publications of the American Nurses Association and the National League for Nursing. Primary journals are indexed from the following allied health fields: Cardiopulmonary Technology, Physical Therapy, Emergency Service, Physician Assistant, Health Education, Radiologic Technology, Medical/Laboratory, Technology Therapy, Medical Assistant, Social Service/Health Care, Medical Records, Surgical Technology, Occupational Therapy. ## ##Selected journals are also indexed in the areas of consumer health, biomedicine, and health sciences librarianship. In total, more than 1600 journals are regularly indexed. The database also provides access to healthcare books, nursing dissertations, selected conference proceedings, standards of professional practice, educational software and audiovisual materials in nursing. ## ##More than 11,000 CINAHL subject headings provide specific access to CINAHL citations. Many CINAHL headings are adopted from the National Library of Medicine’s Medical Subject Headings. CINAHL supplements these headings with terms designed specifically for nursing and allied health.

database.name: EBM Reviews: All (UM-MEDSEARCH)
database.database_description: All EBM Reviews in UM-MEDSEARCH includes the full text of the Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews and the ACP Journal Club. Also included are the Cochrane Database of Systematic Reviews and the Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials.

database.name: Calcium and Calcified Tissue Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Indexes bone metabolism and diseases, tooth development, nerve transmission, muscle contraction, hormone secretion, and other aspects of calcium's roles in biology and medicine.

database.name: Ceramic Abstracts/World Ceramics Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Provides comprehensive coverage of all areas of ceramics manufacturing, processing, and applications including commercial and economic information, legislation and standards, and health and safety aspects.

database.name: Composites Industry Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Focuses on polymers and ceramics reinforced with fibers, honeycombs, whiskers and laminates. A subset of the Engineered Materials Abstracts (EMA) database.

database.name: Nucleic Acids Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: A bibliographic database that contains information on all aspects of nucleic acid research, including: purines, pyrimidines, analogs, nucleosides, nucleotides, RNA, transfer RNA, DNA, DNA repair, enzymes, RNases, DNases, polymerases, phosophorylases, etc.

database.name: AgeLine (CSA)
database.database_description: AgeLine, produced by the American Association of Retired Persons (AARP), provides bibliographic coverage of social gerontology--the study of aging in social, psychological, health-related, and economic contexts. The delivery of health care for the older population and its associated costs and policies is particularly well covered, as are public policy, employment, and consumer issues.

database.name: MEDLINE (Ovid)
database.database_description: The MEDLINE database is widely recognized as the premier source for bibliographic and abstract coverage of biomedical literature. MEDLINE encompasses information from Index Medicus, Index to Dental Literature, and International Nursing, as well as other sources of coverage in the areas of allied health, biological and physical sciences, humanities and information science as they relate to medicine and health care, communication disorders, population biology, and reproductive biology.

database.name: EBM Reviews - ACP Journal Club
database.database_description: The ACP Journal Club Collection consists of two journals ACP Journal Club, a publication of the American College of Physicians, and Evidence-Based Medicine, a joint publication with the British Medical Journal Group. ##The editors of ACP Journal Club screen the top clinical journals on a regular basis and identify studies that are both methodologically sound and clinically relevant. They write an enhanced abstract of the chosen articles and provide a commentary on the value of the article for clinical practice. Using this source, clinicians can quickly understand and apply to their practice important changes in medical knowledge, without having to read and synthesize for themselves thousands of journal articles.

database.name: Education Abstracts (OCLC)
database.database_description: Education Abstracts covers every age and sector of the educational community from preschool through college. It is a bibliographic database that cites every article of at least one column in length in more than 400 English-language periodicals and yearbooks published in the United ##States and elsewhere. It abstracts selected series and supplements and cites book reviews.

database.name: Health Reference Center Academic [InfoTrac Web]
database.database_description: Indexes 205 nursing, allied health, and medical journals, consumer health magazines and newsletters (with full text articles for 150 of them), plus 500 pamphlets, 6 reference books, over 1800 topical overviews, and referral information (all in full text).

database.name: Algology Mycology & Protozoology Abstracts (Microbiology C)
database.database_description: Covers literature on algae, fungi, protozoa, and lichens; including the areas of reproduction, growth, life cycles, biochemistry, genetics, and infection and immunity in humans, other animals, and plants.

database.name: Bacteriology Abstracts (Microbiology B) (CSA)
database.database_description: Indexes journal articles in bacteriology, ranging from cell structure and function, identification, antibacterial agents, and immunology to taxonomy.

database.name: AGRICOLA (CSA)
database.database_description: A bibliographic database of the agricultural literature, containing records of materials acquired by the National Agriculture Library (NAL) and cooperating institutions. Index to articles in agriculture, soil sciences, forestry, and related areas.

database.name: Criminal Justice Abstracts
database.database_description: Criminal Justice Abstracts, the criminology database from Sage Publications, Inc., contains comprehensive coverage of international journals, books, reports, dissertations and unpublished papers on criminology and related disciplines. ##Prepared in co-operation with the Criminal Justice Collection of Rutgers University Library, Criminal Justice Abstracts covers crime trends, crime prevention and deterrence, juvenile delinquency, juvenile justice, police, courts, punishment and sentencing. ##The database contains indexes and summaries of international journal articles, books, and governmental and non-governmental reports on virtually any topic in criminal justice. ##This information is indispensible for academic institutions and government agencies and departments where researchers are studying criminal justice, sociology, social work, law, and education.

database.name: WorldCat (OCLC)
database.database_description: Over 40 million records describing books, periodicals, sound recordings, videos, musical scores, archival materials and much more. Shows what materials are held by most libraries in North America and some in Europe.

database.name: WorldCat (OCLC)
database.database_description: Over 40 million records describing books, periodicals, sound recordings, videos, musical scores, archival materials and much more. Shows what materials are held by most libraries in North America and some in Europe.

database.name: CQ Supreme Court Collection
database.database_description: Provides historical analysis and commentary of Supreme Court decisions, biographies of Supreme Court justices, Supreme Court institutional history, and the U.S. Constitution.

database.name: LegalTrac
database.database_description: Indexes major law reviews, law journals, specialty law and bar association journals, and legal newspapers covering U.S. federal and state cases, laws, government regulations & legal practice; British Commonwealth, European Union & international law; etc. Includes some full-text.

database.name: CQ Researcher Plus Archive
database.database_description: CQ Researcher is noted for its in-depth, unbiased coverage of health, social trends, criminal justice, international affairs, education, the environment, technology, and the economy. Reports are published weekly in print and online 44 times a year by CQ Press, a division of Congressional Quarterly Inc. ####Each single-themed, 12,000-word report is researched and written by a seasoned journalist. The consistent, reader-friendly organization provides researchers with an introductory overview; background and chronology on the topic; an assessment of the current situation; tables and maps; pro/con statements from representatives of opposing positions; and bibliographies of key sources.

database.name: CQ (Congressional Quarterly) Weekly Report
database.database_description: Analytical articles on Congressional legislation and politics since 1983 and roll call votes since 1995.

database.name: Alt-Press Watch (ProQuest)
database.database_description: A full text database of over 60 newspapers, magazines and journals of the alternative and independent press, covering ecology and the environment, grassroots organizing, labor, indigenous peoples, public policy, genetics, and much more.

database.name: American Chemical Society (ACS) Journals
database.database_description: Provides full-text access to scholarly journals in chemistry and chemical engineering published or hosted by the American Chemical Society.

database.name: Animal Behavior Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Index of journal articles relevant to animal behavior, including topics from neurophysiology to behavioral ecology, and genetics to applied ethology, also covers particular taxonomic groups.

database.name: Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Abstracts (ASFA) (CSA)
database.database_description: Contains subfiles: ASFA1 Biological Sciences, ASFA2 Ocean Technolgy, ASFA3 Aquatic Pollution and Environmental Quality, ASFA Aquaculture, and ASFA Marine Biotchnology Abstracts

database.name: Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Abstracts - Biological Sciences & Living Resources (ASFA 1) (CSA)
database.database_description: Extensive indexing coverage of literature on basic and applied research on aquatic organisms. All aspects of marine, freshwater, and brackishwater organisms and environments are covered, including related legal, policy, and socioeconomic issues.

database.name: Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Abstracts - ASFA Aquaculture Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Covers all aspects of marine, brackish and freshwater aquaculture, including techniques, biological reproduction and growth, economics and management.

database.name: Biology Digest (CSA)
database.database_description: A compilation of abstracts and indexes of domestic and international material in the life sciences intended primarily for high school and undergraduate college students. Covers botany, ecology, zoology, environmental studies, medicine, psychology, etc.

database.name: BioOne Abstracts and Indexes (CSA)
database.database_description: This BioOne bibliographic database is an indexed and fully-searchable collection of abstracts that link to the fulltext articles available from the BioOne organization. BioOne provides a unique aggregation of over 65 high-impact bioscience research journals from more than 50 publishers. Additional publishers and journals will be added over time, and the aggregation will ultimately encompass over 200 bioscience titles. These titles are produced by societies and non-commercial publishers and a majority were previously available only in printed form. BioOne was developed by the American Institute of Biological Sciences (AIBS), SPARC (the Scholarly Publishing and Academic Resources Coalition), the University of Kansas, the Greater Western Library Alliance, and Allen Press. The organization is committed to a non-profit objective of disseminating important, scholarly information focused on the biological, ecological and environmental sciences by recovering costs while ensuring sustainability. More information can be found at www.bioone.org.

database.name: General Science Abstracts (OCLC)
database.database_description: Indexes over 160 leading scientific journals and magazines published in the U.S. and Great Britain. Basic, core coverage across all scientific fields, from astronomy to zoology.

database.name: Zoological Record Plus
database.database_description: Zoological Record Plus (ZR Plus), produced by BIOSIS, provides extensive coverage of the world's zoological and animal science literature, covering research from biochemistry to veterinary medicine. The database provides an easily searched collection of references from over 4,500 international serial publications, plus books, meetings, reviews and other non serial literature from over 100 countries.

database.name: Copper Data Center (CSA)
database.database_description: Provides bibliographic coverage of literature on the properties, performance and applications of copper and copper alloys, and on copper technology, from smelting and hydrometallurgy through the end-use applications of copper metals.

database.name: Solid State and Superconductivity Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: Solid State and Superconductivity Abstracts, expanded and jointly published with Engineering Information, presents global coverage on all aspects of theory, production, and application of solid state materials and devices - as well as the new high- and low-temperature superconductivity technology. Among the topics covered: phase, crystal, and mechanical properties of solids , optical and dielectric properties , conductive and magnetic properties , exotic electronic structure and energy gaps , SQUIDs , impurity effects , flux structures and critical current , ceramics , twinning phenomena, and more.

database.name: SPIRES HEP Literature Database
database.database_description: An index to the literature of the particle and high-energy physics community, which has been run by the Stanford Linear Accelerator Center(SLAC) since the late 1960's.

database.name: Biological + Agricultural Index (OCLC)
database.database_description: Biological and Agricultural Index is a bibliographic database that cites articles from more than 300 periodicals. Periodical coverage includes a wide range of scientific journals, from popular to professional, that pertain to biology, agriculture, forestry and ecology. It indexes English-language periodicals published in the United States and elsewhere.

database.name: Zoological Record Plus
database.database_description: Zoological Record Plus (ZR Plus), produced by BIOSIS, provides extensive coverage of the world's zoological and animal science literature, covering research from biochemistry to veterinary medicine. The database provides an easily searched collection of references from over 4,500 international serial publications, plus books, meetings, reviews and other non serial literature from over 100 countries.

database.name: Columbia International Affairs Online (CIAO)
database.database_description: Full text of conference proceedings, think tank articles, some journals, and working papers on international affairs.

database.name: ERIC - Education Resources Information Center
database.database_description: ERIC is a bibliographic database of more than 1.1 million education-related citations going back to 1966. Thye database also includes more than 107,000 full-text non-journal documents (issued 1993-2004).

database.name: ERIC (CSA)
database.database_description: The ERIC (Educational Resources Information Center) database is sponsored by the U.S. Department of Education to provide extensive access to educational-related literature. This version of ERIC allows you to limit results to peer-reviewed journal articles. The ERIC database corresponds to two printed journals: Resources in Education (RIE) and Current Index to Journals in Education (CIJE). Both journals provide access to some 14,000 documents and over 20,000 journal articles per year.

database.name: LISA: Library and Information Science Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: LISA: Library and Information Science Abstracts is an international abstracting and indexing tool designed for library professionals and other information specialists. ## ##LISA currently abstracts over 440 periodicals from more than 68 countries and in more than 20 different languages. ##Major areas of coverage include: ##Artificial intelligence; Book reviews; CD-ROMs; ##Computer applications; Information centres; Information technology, storage and management; ##Internet technology; Knowledge management; ##Librarianship; Libraries and archives; Library management, use and users; Medical information; ##Online information retrieval; Publishing and bookselling; Records management; Telecommunications and the Web.

database.name: Library Literature (OCLC)
database.database_description: Index to 200 U.S. and international library and information science journals, plus more than 600 books per year.

database.name: Social Services Abstracts (CSA)
database.database_description: CSA Social Services Abstracts provides bibliographic coverage of current research focused on social work, human services, and related areas, including social welfare and social policy. The database abstracts and indexes over 1,300 serial publications, and includes journal articles, dissertations and book reviews. Searches link to Community of Scholars: Social Sciences
